pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.6: _Pajānāth’āvuso_, literally, “You know, friends.” According to {DA.2.436}: _Tvaṃ pajānāhīti tvaṃ jāna. Sace gaṇhitukāmosi, gaṇhāhīti vuttaṃ hoti_.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.6: The last of these three ways of knowing presumably refers to the group of travelers (i.e. the thieves or one of them) telling him directly. See discussion in note to Relinquishment 30, {MS.1.2425}.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.15: Half a _yojana_. The length of a _yojana_ is uncertain, and perhaps it never was a precise distance. But a reasonable estimate is 8 miles or just under 13 kilometers (see ACMC, p.16). Thus half a _yojana_ is just over 6 km.
